events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the highway involving their car and a truck.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing incident details mentioning car collision.
An agent was assigned promptly to assist the customer with their auto accident claim processing.
The customer was notified that their vehicle accident claim has been received and is under review.
The company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the accident report.
Customer submitted all required documents including photos, police report, and insurance details.
The insurance investigation team began assessing the vehicle damage and circumstances of the collision.
Investigators completed the review, confirming that the customerâ€™s car was damaged due to the accident.
An initial settlement offer was proposed based on repair estimates and vehicle assessment.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, requesting a review.
Due to customer feedback, the claim was escalated to senior management for further review.
After review, the higher settlement amount was approved and communicated back to the customer.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer for the auto repair costs covered under the policy.
The claim was formally closed following successful settlement and payment completion.
